metadata.notes: Structured timeline for Tesla HW generations, software milestones, and regulatory actions. Populate during Phase 1 research.

hardware_generations.notes: Transitional hardware. Used Nvidia silicon before Tesla's in-house chip.
First Tesla-designed silicon. Dual redundant SoC. ~144 TOPS. Retrofit program offered for HW2.5 owners.

hardware_generations.foundry: To be confirmed (reported: Samsung 7nm or TSMC)
hardware_generations.notes: Significant compute uplift. Camera count changes (removed USS initially, some markets re-added). Broader sensor changes debated.
TO BE RESEARCHED. Naming reconciliation required. See Q7 in forecast registry.

software_milestones.significance: First city-street capable autonomous driving beta to non-employees
Major architecture shift from rule-based planning to end-to-end learned behavior
Broad rollout of end-to-end stack; widely reported improvement in driving smoothness

regulatory_actions.action: Opened formal investigation into Autopilot crashes (PE 22-002)
regulatory_actions.impact: Ongoing scrutiny of Tesla's driver monitoring and crash patterns

regulatory_actions.action: Recall 23V-838: 2M+ vehicles for Autopilot remedial OTA
regulatory_actions.impact: Required additional driver monitoring safeguards and attention alerts

hypotheses.claim: A15 == AI5 == HW5 (single next-generation compute platform for vehicles)
hypotheses.resolution_criteria: Teardown or FCC filing showing board marked A15 in a production vehicle context

hypotheses.claim: A15 is a datacenter/training chip; AI5/HW5 is the vehicle inference chip (separate products)
hypotheses.resolution_criteria: Tesla documentation or earnings call distinguishing vehicle vs datacenter silicon naming

naming_reconciliation.notes: Tesla has used overlapping naming conventions. Dojo chips, vehicle inference chips, and training cluster chips may have independent naming. Do not assume mapping without evidence.
